oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Iroquois Memorial Steeplechase, circa 1942, 1943
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Here for the Iroquois Challenge Cup in May is run the Iroquois Memorial Steeplechase . This equestrian event is an example of the sport of the days of Andrew Jackson, seventh president of the United States, in the contests between thoroughbreds. On race is also run the Truxton Purse, named for Andrew Jackson's famous thoroughbred horse. Crowds up to 40,000 gather on the bluegrass hills to witness the Iroquois races. Forms part of the Iroquois Steeplechase, 1942, 1943, oversize photographs. 1 b&w photograph.
